page.title: 05CRANAGE HALL HOSPITAL
page.content: The hall was designed by Thomas Hall over 200 years ago. When he died it was bought by the Carver family. Eventually the Carver family decided to convert it into a hospital for mentally handicapped patients. Now there are around 300 residential patients and over 100 staff. The old hall is now a nurses home. The hospital grounds are very attractive and have many trees and ponds to make it as pleasant as possible for both patients and staff. The wards are named after the trees, like Maple, Cherry and Birch. The hospital also has its own garages for the hospital transport and maintainance vehicles, and offices for administration. The grounds of the hospital cover a large area and some of it is rented out to local farmers for grazing cattle and growing crops.
